**The KarambolageNed portfolio**

# Introduction

This **portfolio** consist of a maximum of 100 values whereas the top 12 stock should compromise at least 60% of the total value.

```{r}
#| echo: false
#| output: false
#| include: false

rm(list = ls())

#load packages
library(tidyquant)
library(quantmod)
library(ggplot2)
library(tidyverse)
library(tidyquant)
library(plotly)
library(readxl)
library(ggrepel)
library(gt)
library(reshape)
```

```{r}
#| warning: false
#| echo: false
#| output: false
#| include: false

#get dividends
#get data from the Google sheets 
portfolio_df <- read_excel("data/NedPortfolio_Management.xlsx")
portfolio_df <- portfolio_df%>% filter(!is.na(Kaufkurs))

```

```{r}
#| warning: false
#| echo: false
#| output: false
#| include: false

# Create the pie chart
p1 <- ggplot(portfolio_df, aes(x = "", y = Wert, fill = Wertpapier)) +
  geom_bar(width = 1, stat = "identity") +
  coord_polar("y", start = 0) +
  theme_void() +
  theme(legend.position = "none") + # Remove the legend
  geom_text_repel(aes(label = paste0(Wertpapier, ": ", Wert)), 
                  position = position_stack(vjust = 0.5), 
                  size = 4) + # Add labels with ggrepel
  labs(title = "Portfolio Distribution")

```

```{r}
#| warning: false
#| echo: false
#| output: true
#| include: true

p1

```
